description.en: During the course, an overview is given about project management theory and methods. Based on these, students are asked to write a project proposal. Among other things, main project management rules and requirements are introduced and special attention is also given to report writing and project evaluation.
description.et: Kursuse käigus antakse ülevaade projektijuhtimise teooriast ja meetoditest ning nende teadmiste alusel koostavad tudengid iseseisvalt projekti. Muuhulgas tutvustab kursus nõudeid, millele edukas projekt vastama peab. Eraldi pööratakse tähelepanu projekti aruandlusele ja hindamisele. Kursusel on suur praktiline väärtus.

objectives.en: The aim of this course is to introduce the foundations of project management and give practical knowledge all through the project management cycle. During this course, students are advised to pay attention to different aspects of project management regarding project design, planning, implementation, and reporting.
objectives.et: Kursuse peaeesmärgiks on võimaldada osalejatel omandada nii teoreetilisi teadmisi kui praktilisi oskusi erinevatest projektide arendamise ja juhtimisega seotud aspektidest. Kursuse käigus seletatakse lahti projekti mõiste ning selgitatakse, kuidas planeerida projekti tegevusi ja ressursse. Tutvustatakse projektitsükli erinevaid faase ning antakse ülevaade projektide arendamisest. Õpetatakse, kuidas koostada tööde graafikut ja eelarvet. Kursus selgitab, kellest koosneb projekti inimressurss ning milline on projektijuhi roll projekti juhtimisel. Kirjeldatakse võtteid, millega tagada hea meeskonna valik ning kuidas hinnata projekti tulemusi. Kursus on koostatud erinevaid juhtimispõhimõtteid arvestades ning annab hea ülevaate erinevatest projektijuhtimises kasutatavatest tehnikatest.

learning_outcomes.en: - Obtain thorough knowledge about the underlying principles of project management.
learning_outcomes.et: - Omandab sügavamad teadmised projektijuhtimise alustalade kohta.

learning_outcomes.en: - Understand the rules of project management and are able to analyse these in the context of implementation in a specific situation.
learning_outcomes.et: - Mõistab projektijuhtimise põhimõtteid ja suudab neid analüüsida konkreetses kontekstis rakendatavuse seisukohast lähtuvalt.

learning_outcomes.en: - Acquire sufficient training for writing projects, implementing them and reporting on activities and using resources.
learning_outcomes.et: - On saanud piisava ettevalmistuse, et iseseisvalt projekte kirjutada, ellu viia ja teostatud tegevuste kohta aru anda.

learning_outcomes.en: - Are skillful in evaluating different projects.
- Know how to compile a project budget and put together a working schedule.
learning_outcomes.et: - Koostab edukalt projekti eelarvet ja töögraafikut.

learning_outcomes.en: - Are able to reason the importance of a project to funders and other interested parties.
learning_outcomes.et: - Põhjendab konkreetse projekti olulisust ja vajalikkust nii rahastajatele kui huvitatud osapooltele.

Format of the lectures - in class learning, participation is required.

Kick off project and Mid-term reporting
Participation in and development of common class larger project. Developing work packages in individual groups and evaluating the progress. Successful participation means a student has:
1) participated in the kickoff meeting 5pts.
2) demonstrated their active role in their team work package implementation during the evaluation week
5pts.

Final group report and assessment of project preparation process prepared by each member of the group separately. 
Students demonstrate the completion of their work package and coordination with other 'partners' or groups to contribute to the entire process.
Assessment criteria: 
- Student was present for all parts of the project simulation and contributed to group work independently.
- Students provide enough detail about their process in the work package and evaluation of group teamwork.
- Students demonstrate that they can apply concepts from class to the practical implementation of a simulated work package. 
- Students demonstrate that they can critically assess their own and their team mates' contribution to group work  
20 points

grade_preconditions.et:
To be eligible for the final grade, students are expected 
To attend at least 80% of the lectures. 
To meet the total calculated weighted grade 51 or above on participation, the project proposal and the project simulation.

Principles of project management: Getting to know different funders. What are some different types of funders, projects, and funding schemes? Which funding schemes best match which types of projects? What considerations need to be made for the different types of funders and schemes?
